posts.post_content:
Sounds like BS, but these were stored tightly crammed inside wood cigar boxes in Boston for generations. 

Hand sorted and appear to be crease-free, VG+ quality Piedmont lot. Most corners show mild wear. Has some horizontals, several minor leaguers and may hold a stray HOF or two. Backs are the same shape, though a few will have a stamping. I'll enclose a few extras, just in case. 

Send an email offer to;
[url]fdnyladder7@comcast.net[/url]
Steve is rock solid if anyone was wondering.  The group of cards is really nice and he spot on with the grading.  In some cases he is conservative.
I'll trade you a 1969 ex bb set and a bunch of other stuff for that group, a nice reggie rookie in there, nobody likes those old cards anyway... :)
see the card in the 2nd row that is sandwiched in between the 4 horizontals of Patee, Murphy, Mullen, and Birmingham?  What card is that?
